brief_title: A Study to Test the Safety and Tolerability of a New Medication in the Treatment of Schizophrenia
brief_summary: A 1-year outpatient study to test the safety and tolerability of a new medication in the treatment of schizophrenia
detailed_description: Study will evaluate long-term safety and tolerability of a new compound in the treatment of patients with schizophrenia as assessed by adverse events (AEs), measures of extra pyramidal symptoms (EPS; Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale [AIMS], Barnes Akathisia Scale [BAS], and Simpson-Angus Rating Scale [SAS]), vital sign measurements, electrocardiograms (ECGs), clinical laboratory evaluations.
criteria: - Patients must have participated in study D1050196 (A Study to Test the Effectiveness and Safety of a New Medication in the Treatment of Schizophrenia) and either: - Successfully completed - OR - Patients must have been discontinued after a minimum of 2 weeks of treatment due to lack of efficacy
